Reviews.Title: “A restorative visit”
Reviews.Author: Trotwood
Reviews.Content: They invested a ton of money a few years ago on a high-end renovation/restoration of this beautiful Victorian mansion located in the Banker's Hill area of San Diego, just off of Balboa Park and within a short walk of several good restaurants (one is literally across the street, on the top floor of a 12 story building). We spent two nights in the Library Room, on the first floor, with no other rooms sharing a wall making it very quiet. The room had a 10 foot ceiling, like the rest of the first floor, and a huge bay window looking west that flooded the room with light. A wardrobe furniture piece was used for a closet, certainly adequate for a short stay. The TV was a small LCD unit connected to the usual litany of cable channels. There was a DVD player if you want to bring your favorite movies. Two upholstered chairs and a round table were in the bay window area. Window coverings, bed covers and decorative pillows were all very tasteful and top quality. An individual room thermostat for the quiet, forced-air heating/cooling system allowed us to keep the room delightfully cool while we slept in the very comfortable bed. The bathroom was large and had a very large, etched glass window bringing in lots of light. The claw foot tub was charming but negotiating the wrap-around shower curtain for taking a shower was a minor challenge. The towel warmer was a thoughtful touch and the terry robes were high quality, as were the towels and bed linens. The late afternoon wine and cheese offering was nicely done. Morning breakfast, served from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 a.m. every morning, was excellent. Orange juice and very good coffee were available in advance of a freshly baked pastry (muffin one day, scone the next) that was artfully served with fresh berries and creme fraiche. Three additional items were offered for choice: an omelet (or scramble); eggs any style with chicken sausage; and home-made granola with yogurt and fruit. The dining room was beautifully set with Wedgewood china and quality linens. Tables were also available outside on the porch or in the garden. Parking is available in their driveway for three cars in a row (which can be somewhat inconvenient) or in a small lot diagonally across the street for no extra charge. For a pleasant few days of vacation in the San Diego area, the Britt Scripps Inn would certainly be an excellent choice of a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: LuvSLO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in March to celebrate our wedding anniversary and enjoyed it very much. Although we live in San Diego, we wanted to sleep somewhere else to celebrate our anniversary and this was the perfect place! The property is very unique and has undergone extensive restorations that make it lovely. We stayed in the Balboa room which was very large, elegantly appointed and distinctly victorian. It had a king sized bed that was very comfortable but it seems the mattress might need replacing soon, as I thought I sensed a bit of a sag in the middle. We had a private balcony off the room which was a great place to sit in the morning. I found the bathroom, while charming with its pedestal sink and clawfoot tub, to be a little small. With there being no counter to place toiletries, it was a little challenging to get ready for our evening out. And while I'm sure bathing in a claw foot tub would be quite a unique experience, showering was challenging because it's so compact. There was also an unpleasant odor in the bathroom but I didn't mention it to the innkeepers since we stayed only one night. The room was very quiet expect for the occasional plane flying over in the morning since this area is below the flight path for the airport. That being said, it's also in a great location because it's close to all of the great restaurants in Banker's Hill and downtown. The room was also very dark in the morning due to the blackout curtains, which I loved. I enjoyed the evening wine and cheese reception and it's touches like this that make staying in B&Bs so worth it! In addition to serving great wines, it was nice to chat with other guests staying at the B&B. There was a tray of freshly baked chocolate chip cookies always available in the parlor which was great as well.. The grounds are beautiful and taking breakfast on the front porch was absolutely lovely. My husband brought a bottle of champagne so that we could enjoy it with breakfast and the staff had no problem chilling it for us. We both enjoyed the breakfast that was served; a scone and fresh berries, fresh orange juice, an omelet for him and eggs for me. I wasn't offere tea but would've liked some because I start all of my days with a cup of it. I'm not sure if they don't offer it in general or just didn't offer it to me. Check in and check out went smoothly and they even extended our checkout time until 1:00 which allowed us to enjoy a leisurely morning. Overall, I would recommend the property for a unique getaway, though it is a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing antiques”
Reviews.Author: Karimark_12
Reviews.Content: We LOVE Britt Scripps. The restoration that has been done on this beautiful home is outstanding. And their service is excellent. The linens were wonderful and the claw foot tub was so fun. If you appreciate history this is a great place. We cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic San Diego history”
Reviews.Author: LynnBarbee
Reviews.Content: An absolute delight in every way. The Victorian house is beautifully restored with breathtaking attention to detail - the decor, furnishings, ornaments - everything is in keeping with the era but without the cloying kitschness sometimes associated with victoriana. The bed was super comfortable, the linens luxurious, the bathroom a joy. The service was friendly and efficient and we couldn't fault the breakfast - homemade muffins and granola and hot food perfectly cooked to order. The staff were quite happy to serve us in the pretty garden where we could smoke without bothering other guests. A relaxing retreat close enough to the city to be convenient but far enough to be peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint B&B in a real Victorian Home”
Reviews.Author: alohadawn
Reviews.Content: This is a small, quaint operation. The rave reviews on service from Frommers may lead one to expect a Four Seasons type experience. This is not that. It is personal service from a very small staff at a 9 guest B&B. We did not receive turn down service either night that we were there, for unknown reasons. If you want turn down service, best to request it. The breakfast was very nice, served in the dining or living room; -starting with good coffee, fresh baked muffin or scone, berries and cream, followed by your choice of two egg entree's of the day and a homemade granola/yogurt option. The evening wine and cheese is offered, self service, from nice trays in the home's elegant small living room. There was no one playing the piano, ever, during our two night stay over Valentines weekend. The recorded music played in the common areas and during breakfast is "standards" muzak... Not too offensive, familiar, but gentle classical would have been an improvement. There is parking available for 3 cars, one behind the other, in the driveway to the carriage house and street parking on busy downtown streets. You turn in keys and pick up keys from the person in the main house upon arriving and departing each time. There is no vallet. It is best to not be in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Historic, Charming House with Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: mmullins0767
Reviews.Content: If you have never before stayed in a bed and breakfast, I would recommend trying this place. The house and grounds are beautiful, with each room uniquely designed and furnished. The location was perfect, steps away from Balboa Park and close enough, yet far enough away, from the Gas Lamp districts hustle and bustle. All of the house staff were extremely kind and helpful. The breakfast for both mornings were absolutely fresh and delicious. The evening wine and cheese plate offerings such a nice touch. To be honest, I can't complain about anything here. And if you've seen my prior posts, I more often tend to call out the locations to warn travelers where to stay away from. Definitely a thumbs-up recommendation from me for the Britt Inn. Best regards, Mike

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: 1suelu
Reviews.Content: This is a top notch bed and breakfast. The home has been renovated in beautiful details. The staff is friendly and the food is amazing. Will definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Delight”
Reviews.Author: boballee
Reviews.Content: We looked for a special place to stay in San Diego for our 50th Wedding Anniversary. We found it and some! This 1887 Victorian bed and breakfast has nine bedrooms that are fully updated and very nice. We stayed five nights in the "Garden Room" and enjoyed every minute of it. Each morning we were served a gourmet breakfast starting with fruit, yogurt, and a scone or croissant. This was followed with a gourmet egg dish prepared by Paula, a very talented chef. From 5:00 to 7:00 each evening the staff serves hors d'oeuvres of meats, special cheeses and crackers with wine. The staff was very attentive and took care of our every need. The location of the B&B is perfect, and only two blocks from Balboa Park and several very good museums and restaurants. We will definitely stay at Britt Scripps Inn the next time we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very sexy room!”
Reviews.Author: Shoshin
Reviews.Content: The Britt Scripps is such a beautiful property...a gorgeously restored Victorian home. The rooms are all different but the Gothic is why I chose this Inn for our night out. This is not Halloween Gothic, but classic sumptuous and luxurious Gothic. All the comforts you need plus ambiance galore. There is a lovely wine and cheese hour in the evening and breakfast in the morning. The breakfast, for me, is the only weak spot. It was good, just not great. I would be remiss to forget mentioning Al, our host for our stay. Pleasant, efficient, helpful....yet always unobtrusive. It is located right by Balboa Park and there are many restaurants within walking distance and of course a very close Starbucks. I would return in a heartbeat (and indeed already have plans to do so!).

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: auntie-ellie-22
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay and thought this place was excellent. We stayed in the Garden Room and although it didn't look as elegant as the other rooms it was very comfortable and as we overlooked the garden was very quiet. We didn't have a car and although it had excellent access to the park it was quite a walk from the Gaslamp area, which wasn't a problem during the day as it was quite a pleasant walk but we wouldn't have felt comfortable at night. So like when we went to the baseball it meant paying for a taxi which could prove to be quite expensive if you planned to spend your evenings in this area. The breakfasts were brilliant and as I do not eat meat or eggs the granola and the scones we delicious. We really only dealt with Martin during our stay and he was brilliant and nothing was too much trouble. We do not see how you could be disappointed with this place its excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and comfortable. Nice location”
Reviews.Author: berniss
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inn because it was close to a business office I attended. I have stayed at a number of B&Bs and this one is exquisitely cared for. There was no sense of it being run down as many B&Bs can be. It was exquisitely furnished with lovely antiques. There is the most beautiful two story stained glass window next to the stairwell. The main floor includes an inviting living room, a large foyer, a breakfast room, and a kitchen and a couple of guest rooms. The second floor has all guest rooms. I stayed in two rooms: the Balboa and the Renaissance. Each are included in the deluxe category and are the largest in the Inn. The Balboa was the original master suite and includes a large bedroom and bathroom, with plenty of storage and a balcony. It was tastefully decorated and had terrific light. My only complaint was that there was no rim or table in the bathroom to put your soap comfortably when taking a bath in the large soaking tub. The Renaissance room was even prettier, but a tad smaller. While the bathroom was smaller, it was actually better laid out. My only complaint with this room was that the lighting was a bit dim. I found the Inn very quiet. You could get to Old Town in 5 minutes, the airport in 10 minutes and walk to Balboa park and nice eating places. I thought the breakfasts were lovely. A bottle of Voss water was included in the room. I wouldn't hesitate to stay again. The Inn should do something about their computer system as it is has glitches and doesn't handle automatic reservations well.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: patsbosoxfan
Reviews.Content: As these reviews show, the Britt Scripps Inn is a beautiful old painted lady. Unfortunately, the inn had some serious flaws. Parking in the driveway is limited . You leave your keys and need to seek out the proprietor every time you want to head out. The location is in a bustling economic center of San Diego. This location is neither quiet nor aesthetically pleasing. The worst part of our expeience was the breakfast. I am vegetarian and had a choice of two meals on the menu. I chose an egg dish that was listed as containing only sun dried tomatoes and cheese. When I took a bite, I tasted meat. I spit it out and asked the proprietor if the dish contained meat. She assured me that I was just tasting the sun-dried tomatoes which she described as having a meaty texture. She did offer to verify this with the chef. When she returned, she notified me that my egg dish contained a turkey sausage. She explained that there was a miscommunication between her and the chef when writing up the menu. I was disgusted at that point. This lack of communication was a serious error which definitely ruined my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, but the bed was too soft! Also Expedia warning.”
Reviews.Author: Kjpelletier
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at the Britt Scripps Inn B&B. It's an old Victorian that was in very good condition. The location was perfect for the Zoo, museums, and the hot, trendy restaurants. Their breakfast was great, fresh baked scones or muffins to start, followed by a choice of 3 entrees. The dining room had 3 tables (and they have 9 rooms) so you may have to wait until a table is free, but we had no problem. They have wine and cheese from 5-7 PM in the parlor. Classical music plays in the background at all times. Overall, it was very pleasant and relaxing. Parking was no problem. When you check in they give you a parking pass for a lot that is kitty corner to the hotel. The hostess was very nice and very helpful with restaurant and other tourist tips. The room was nice (we stayed in the Balboa room). Ladies, if you don't want to wash your hair every time you take a shower, bring your own shower cap. Also there was no clock in the room. That can be a pro or a con depending on your point of view. The linens were very nice and there's a down comforter on the bed. The biggest issue for me was that the bed itself was way too soft. There was a down pillow top on top of the mattress. I could not get comfortable, my back was killing me and I got virtually no sleep. If it weren't for my aching back I'd go back there in a flash. One final Expedia warning... if you book a room through Expedia, and request a king size bed THEY CAN NOT GUARANTEE THAT FOR YOU. Expedia told me they could guarantee a King bed, but when I got the confirmation it was listed as a "request." The owner at the Britt Scripps was nice enough to honor my request, but he didn't have to. At the Expedia rate the hotel normally puts you in the lower priced rooms, and saves the bigger rooms for full paying guests. So don't believe what the Expedia agents tell you!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place - but would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: sandrita55
Reviews.Content: The inn is located next to Balboa park, which is awesome. It is within walking distance of all the museums and the zoo, and some decent restaurants. The inn itself is beautiful, a victorian style house with a large wrapping porch. The room we had (the aesthetic) was lovely too - not cluttered like some b and bs can be. The bathroom had charming antique style furnishings, including a claw foot tub. The tub was cute to look at, but it did not make for a fun showering experience. I consider myself a normal sized person, but I could not take a shower in that tub without touching the shower curtain. The water pressure was not great either. There was also no place to put soap, shampoo etc. except a very small unsteady soap dish like thing attached to the shower. Then when we tried to sleep we found that the room was arranged in just such a way that the charming window over the door let the light from the hallway shine right on our heads. They should put a shade on the window or turn out the light in the hallway that is right outside the door. I am sure that other rooms have different arrangements and different tub styles, and likely don't have the same problems that our room had. My only recommendation is not to stay in the aesthetic. Breakfast was good, not the best I've ever had but good. They give you some choices. They also have wine and hors d'ouvres in the afternoon. The hors d'ouvres are basically cheese and crackers. Finally, regarding parking - I believe the inn has 9 or 10 rooms, but only provide 5 parking spaces - 3 at the inn, and 2 passes for a lot across the street. I will say this - the location is excellent, especially if you are coming to San Diego primarily to see the museums and zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and charming”
Reviews.Author: SoTravelHappy
Reviews.Content: This place was so much fun to stay at! The breakfast is incredible and the staff is so very accommodating. We would love to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful local gem!”
Reviews.Author: mere811
Reviews.Content: We live in San Diego, but have always been intrigued by this inn. I decided to surprise my husband with a night's stay for his birthday. Everything was perfect! We stayed in the Aesthetic room which was gorgeous and the bed was very comfortable. The wine/cheese in the afternoon is such a nice perk and the breakfast was amazing. We hope to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Details, details, details! This inn got it right! Every thing was perfection---highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: akmitchell48
Reviews.Content: We were greeted at the door by Martin, who couldn't have been more accommodating. We arrived just in time for evening cheese and wine---delicious! Had beaucoup restaurants to choose from for dinner, as the inn is so convenient to whatever food your heart desires. Our room was absolutely grand and so true to the Queen Anne period. Our breakfast was superb, with Sarah as hospitality host with a capital H! A perfect B&B experience!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, charming, great location”
Reviews.Author: anne_dougherty
Reviews.Content: My spouse found this B&B/small hotel via Expedia when booking our plane tickets and it was a pleasant surprise as we did more research to learn that it was just a couple of blocks from the entrance to Balboa Park (a plus as my spouse is an avid runner). We stayed in the carriage house for a bit more than a week and as others have remarked, it is a little short on seating space. The only other issue with the carriage house, which I suspect isn't true in the main house, is that the wi-fi is a bit slow. The bed was fabulously comfortable, though. The Inn's location equidistant between the Gaslamp Quarter (downtown, fairly touristy) and Hillcrest (funky, great restaurants) proved to be a boon. Also, you will eat very well at breakfast when staying here. Paula's homemade scones, a different one on each of the 7 mornings we ate breakfast, are divine, as is the homemade granola.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing!”
Reviews.Author: sjpc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Britt Scripps Inn for two nights. The Victorian house is amazing. The beautiful stained glass windows and the winding staircase were preserved from the original construction of the home in 1887. There is a sense of quiet elegance throughout the house. The first night we stayed in the Aesthetic room. It was so nicely decorated. The bed was absolutely posh and comfortable. We wanted to try all the rooms, so the second night we asked to stay at the Carriage House, which is detached from the Victorian house. We returned earlier than the check-in time such that the Carriage House had not been cleaned yet. The staff at Britt Scripps accommodated us; housekeeping cleaned the Carriage House promptly. This was impressive. The Carriage House is not Victorian. It resembles a country home. It is as small as the room we had in the main house. However, it was enjoyable because it was more private/secluded. The windows really made it feel like a small cottage. The house has a private porch in front. The Carriage House was very safe and quiet at night, despite its proximity to the street. The breakfast was very delicious. The chef had no problems altering the menu to cater to our vegetarian palates. Her muffins and scones were the best I have ever tasted. The coffee and tea are bought at a specialty shop; they were so good. Martin and Morgan took care of us while we were there. They were both very welcoming and warm. My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at Britt Scripps Inn. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Olde World Charm in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: barrowboy35
Reviews.Content: Excellent boutique B&B. Seemed rather strange having scones with jam & cream for breakfast but they were jolly good. Great location near the wonderful Balboa Park.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sfbaypaladin
Reviews.Content: Beautiful building. It appears that exterior is pretty intact from it original construction. The interior appears to have been extensively altered to suit the house's current purpose as a B&B except for the exquisite main parlor and staircase. We stayed in the Garden Room which is spacious and beautiful like all of the rooms, but the there's a lot of noise from breakfast being prepared each morning. When we return, we will likely stay on the second floor. The location is great. Only two blocks from the main entrance into Balboa Park. A short walk to the Hillcrest district. We also walked downtown to the Gaslamp District, but took a cab back it was late and uphill the whole way. The hot breakfast is delicious and includes an amazing and different homemade scone everyday.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: LDJW
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to get away for everything familiar to think through the difficult circumstances present in my life. I couldn't have chosen a more PERFECT place. Even if you are not a bed and breakfast type of person, this little SLICE OF HEAVEN deserves to be visited! Every positive adjective you can think of will describe this inn. Ilene, Martin, Nikki and Paula are amazing. This place is immaculate! If you can find a speck of dust anywhere in this place, I will give you 2 cents! :-) It is everything that I needed it to be and more! I will be back to celebrate my victories God has in store for me! What are you waiting for? You need to go NOW!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Inn. Delicious Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: NewMexicoHanna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Britt Scripps Inn for 3 nights while visiting our daughter who lives in San Diego. We chose this neighborhood location near the park as a "change of pace" from our usual La Jolla hotel. The Inn is beautifully restored and immaculately clean! I had reserved the Carriage House based on the limited information given on the website. What the site does NOT provide, is the room size. The Carriage House is very tiny so the bed fills almost the entire room and there are no soft chairs in the room for relaxing. So, you're either in bed or lounging in the big jacuzzi tub! Fortunately, we were able to move to the very large and comfortable Balboa room for the next 2 nights. What a difference! So you might want to inquire about room size before booking because in this case, size DOES matter! Breakfast was absolutely delicious every morning! Paula's scones are the best in the world! The service at this Inn was acceptable, but not outstanding. The "butlers" are young girls who work a 24 hour shift and then are gone. What the Inn did lack was the welcoming warmth of an Inn keeper.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: csaint21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to escape the AZ heat for the weekend and stayed at this B&B the second night. I absolutely loved the experience. The place is drop dead gorgeous! There are stained glass windows, a piano, a spiral staircase. We went around upstairs and checked out other rooms and I would have stayed in any of them. Our room was in the cottage out back and we had the prettiest bathroom ever! Nice Jacuzzi tub that we spent a lot of time in and a wonderful breakfast to follow. You can walk to Balboa Park from here also!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisitely Restored, Superb B and B experience”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: This property (located right on Banker's Hill and a short stroll to Balboa Park) starts with a fabulous location. If "Victorian" era furnishings are your thing this place is heaven. The owner spared no expense in a renovation which provides the best of modern conveniences (ice cold air, wifi, sound proofing) yet still retains all of the period charm. Wine and cheese every evening and (of course) an excellent breakfast are included in the reasonable rates. I would not hesitate to recommend this property or stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, Friendly, Comfortable, and Clean”
Reviews.Author: eastcoaster11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this bed and breakfast instead of a chain hotel. Britt Scripps Inn made our trip quite enjoyable. The location is perfect. We were centrally located and enjoyed the quick drive to the beaches and La Jolla, the walk to the Padres game, the stroll through the Gas Lamp District and Seaport Village, and morning runs into Balboa Park. The staff is spectacular. The main entry area is so well decorated that it feels like you're staying in someone's house rather than a hotel. We would highly recommend staying there just for the breakfast. The chef, Paula, does her job very well. We usually stay at chain hotels and eat their standard breakfast created for the masses. The scones that greeted us every morning with coffee and orange juice were fantastic and definitely were not standard fair for the masses. The breakfast was so filling that we usually weren't hungry for lunch until 2pm. The nightly wine and cheese from 5-7p was a pleasant way to snack in the evening. We enjoyed the appetizers so much that we had to go eat dinner or we would have eaten the entire tray of cheese and crackers ourselves. We stayed in the Gothic room and enjoyed all of the features in that room. The sheets on the bed were so soft and the duvet was so comfortable that crawling into bed each night was a treat. Our room had a balcony and we found ourselves on that everyday. The wireless internet signal extended just far enough so that we could sit on the balcony, enjoy the views, and stay connected. The bathroom was modern and updated, but still maintained that bed and breakfast feel. I wish there was more counter space, but I was able to keep my toiletry bag on the edge of the counter and next to the window. There was a claw foot tub and shower combo that had wonderful shower pressure. The towels and bathrobes that were provided were thick and luxurious. When we interacted with the staff it was like talking to a friend. We worked with Sarah, Lexi, Aileen, and Nikki and can not say enough nice things about each of them. When we wanted some area recommendations they were well versed and friendly. When we had some requests, they were more than accommodating. I have no doubt that staying at this hotel made a great trip into a wonderful memory that we cherish.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Delius17
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time here at this beautiful little hotel just minutes' walk from the park. The butlers were all charming and made you feel very special. Was so glad we stayed here rather than some anonymous downtown hotel. It was wonderfully quiet, gave free parking and scrumptius breakfasts. Would definitely recommend...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect oasis near park and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: LornaD
Reviews.Content: I'm not really a B&B lover, and I prefer modern architecture, BUT this was the most delightful place to stay for an 8-day visit to San Diego. The restoration is lovely, the beds wonderful, sheets high thread count, bathroom new with old tub (great for relaxing), balcony fun to sit on, garden outside a little gem of green and great old tree, wonderful breakfasts, very nice "butlers" (people who spent the night to oversee the place), pleasant wine and cheese late day, and extremely quiet. We also walked to three french-inspired restaurants and cucina urbana. Bertrand at Mr. A's was great, Hexagone was very nice, cucina urbana was okay but busy/loud, 5th avenue was good but not as special interior. And it was just a block walk into Balboa Park. Japanese garden in bloom with wisteria and cherry trees late March. We drove to the zoo but could have walked.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Greenman21262
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place. Romantic, well-appointed, friendly and casual. Some might expect staff to be ever-present, but for those who desire only a place to hide away and enjoy, this is the place. not a bit of street noise, even though it's on a busy street, it has an accommodating staff, even if they are not 'right there' to help (and I'm one who would prefer to find them, not find them at my door waiting for something). The rooms are wonderful. Ours had a lovely balcony overlooking the garden, where late at night we could sip champagne in comfort and privacy. Very romantic for my new bride and I. Our sleep was wonderful. The bed luxurious, the room appointments lavish (even if the room is smaller, to be expected in a very old building), while everything had and updated feel (such as the bathroom, heater, etc). No noise bothered us, we slept right through the morning rush hour. The breakfast, very delicious. They grow some of their herbs on-site, making the simple, yet delicious, fare even more so. Again, service is attentive, and when we were greeted by Eileen in the morning, she was part of this wonderful Victorian experience. For those who want different than the 'normal', for those who want romantic, to be let be to feel the ambience, for those who are not.... cookie-cutter types, I certainly recommend this beautiful place. If you're the sort who needs parking services, who needs someone right there to make sure you have a clean towel (after you've used three), or someone who simply needs your every need met, this might not be for you. But..... If you're the sort who loves.... beauty, romance, interesting, different.... Try this one. You'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Romantic Getaway Surprise”
Reviews.Author: vaj1111
Reviews.Content: I surprised my wife for our 20th anniversary and booked just one night at the Britt Scripps Inn based on my checking out the reviews here at Trip Advisor. We stayed in the Garden Room because my wife likes the Shabby Chic decor and I thought this would be the perfect room for her. She was pleasantly surprised. She loved the thick wide crown moulding, fluffy down comforter on the bed, and wood flooring. The Inn was restored to it's turn of the century grandeur and we enjoyed examining the victorian era furniture and intricate woodwork of the day. The stained glass along the magnificent staircase was beautiful. The staff was very friendly and took the time to make sure our stay was comfortable. Our "Butler" Jenna was very friendly and took the time to show us around the Inn and gave us a guided tour and history lesson of the Inn. Our room faced the back of the Inn and overlooked the garden. It was very quiet and the only thing that woke us up was the smell of the fresh scones baking in the morning. The breakfast was superb!. We both had fresh scrambled eggs with seasoned potatoes and applewood smoked sausage. This was after a large scone served with fresh cream and rasberries. The coffee was outstanding and Jenna served up refill after refill and told us many guests ask for their special recipe. We were served complementery hors d'oeuvres of fine cheeses and crackers along with white and red wine upon our arrival in the conservatory and sat in comfortable chairs and were entertained by two couples we met who were staying at the Inn. This was the best trip and stay for my wife and I and we plan on returning to the Inn with family so they too can experience the atmosphere and comfort of the Britt Scripps Inn. The only negative I could come up with was the parking, since it's limited cars park in a line, one behind the other. If you had to leave the Inn numerous times it might be a pain. In our case we only left once, Jenna moved the car behind us and the second time we were in the back, no problem. I read that noise can be a problem here but since our room faced the garden we didn't experience any. Another potential concern would be the Claw Foot Tub. We had a shower in the Garden Room so it wasn't a problem but the couple we spoke too had one and they did saw it was a little tough to climb in. It's beautiful though, just something to think about if you are older.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Experience”
Reviews.Author: MontyandThea
Reviews.Content: After a rocky experience at another Bankers Hill (San Diego) B&B, the Britt Scripps staff welcomed us with warmth and superior service. The Inn is beautiful and well-appointed and the breakfast was sumptuous. We heartily recommend the Britt Scripps; we will surely return!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Bliss at Britt Scripps”
Reviews.Author: missmeghan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Britt Scripps for our wedding night in October. I had been searching for quite some time for a hotel where I could check in early and get ready for our wedding. I found a great price on orbitz and I called the Inn directly and they matched it. They put us in the Carriage House, which is the old garage turned into a little cottage. The Carriage house is absolutely adorable, and couldn't have been more perfect. It's not very large - but it was perfect for us. It's decorated so cute and the finishes are actually quite top-notch. The sheets were some ridiculously high thread count, I kept saying to my husband "we have to find some of these sheets for home." I think the bed was the most comfortable I've ever had at a hotel. The inside of the main house is absolutely gorgeous, though we didn't spend but maybe ten minutes there. We sat out on the front porch for the included breakfast. They ended up taking so long to bring us our food, we had somewhere to be and didn't get to eat. But the coffee and the scones were absolutely delicious - I imagine the breakfast would have been too. It didn't really bother us because by that point we were full anyway. I highly recommend Britt Scripps and am so pleased that we found such a wonderful place to stay for our big day. We look forward to going back there over the years to come.

Reviews.Title: “I am in Love”
Reviews.Author: rockinraffi
Reviews.Content: Ok, I don't know where to start other than this place Rocks! The food is Gourmet Homemade. The scones ohhh the scones I'm going back for more. The Staff was amazingly great with happy smiles and helpful tips for around the town dine out places. For the first time going to a B+B it was an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location”
Reviews.Author: SoCalBoy
Reviews.Content: The Inn has many charming qualities from the gardens outside to the period furniture inside. The Inn's staff were extremely friendly and knowledgeable of the San Diego area. The breakfast was an additional plus with several items to select from. I stayed in the Balboa Room and I did not get as much noise as the other reviewers. The location is two blocks from the Park and a short cab ride from the Airport or Train station. It's also centrally located to other attractions such as the San Diego Zoo, Sea World Horton Plaza, and Old Town. If my travels take me back down to San Diego, I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better, especially for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Eisen90120
Reviews.Content: Went to this B & B expecting the quality of service this price and style suggest; found noisy rooms (not street noise) and a different "butler" each day! Could not get to know any of the staff because there was always someone diffrent. The breakfast at first was a home made scone. After consumption, the 'butler' returns to take our ouder for a 'hot breakfast'. Had she informed us upon our seating that there would be 2 breakfasts, we would not have finished the scone. Hint to launderer; make sure the cloth napkins are completely DRY prior to storing!! Parking is just the driveway behind the house; 1-2 cars max and in single-file. "wine and cheese" reception in afternoons was 'small'. House is beautiful and this is perhaps the only place you can stay and 'live' among true Victorian antiques, but for the 6 million (yes, 6 million) spent on this place, service could be better. Gordon, how about having some way for guests to acquire a coke, coffee or a snack in the middle of the night???

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Classic”
Reviews.Author: katie2275
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Britt Scripps Inn for two nights. We were in the library on the first floor. The only negative was the room is a little loud with single pane windows against the road traffic. However, we slept well through the noise because the bed was so comfortable. The sheets were 1000 count cotton. The mattress was soft, but supportive. Our bathroom was in style with a claw-tub and a towel warmer. We received a bottle of Voss water and chocolates on our pillows. The lights in the bedroom can be dimmed to be very romantic! The butler staff is courtousy and helpful. They can give recommendations, maps, and coupons to just about anything you'd want to do in San Diego. The breakfast is scrumptious with hot strong coffee, a fresh warm scone, and homemade omelets or pancakes. The house it self it historical and elegant. There is a large stained glass window along the stair case, with a baby grand piano stationed below. The stair case banister is original (along with most of the wood work). The butler staff is there to answer questions you may have and to explain the history of the house. Our first night there, my husband and I walked across Balboa Park to the Prado restaurant. We had a romantic dinner and amazing drinks and were able to just walk home. Our second night we in the gas lamp district, where the food was more expensive and not as good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: SwedeSanDiego_Ca
Reviews.Content: The reviews below are accurate. This hotel has been buffed out and is in great condition. The staff were friendly and the breakfast was excellent. Our experience was great until we tried to sleep. The (historic) single pane windows don't stop street noise from buses, trucks and airplanes. If you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “paradise”
Reviews.Author: rivercross
Reviews.Content: What an amazing place. We booked having read reviews etc on trip advisor. The staff were all so friendly and efficient. Nothing was too much trouble and always on hand to offer suggestions of places to visits etc. The ambience of the building was amazing. We stayed for 5 nights before travelling on to Honolulu and loved every minute of our stay. The bedroom (the library room) was just perfect (that bed was so comfy). The hotel provides complimentary off street parking - so handy After a long enjoyable day sight seeing etc it was just bliss to return to Britt Scripps for wine and cheese and a lovely bath in that glorious bathroom. San Diego was a beautiful city and if we return (I hope we do) we will certainly be returning to Britt Scripps Thanks again everyone for a very memorable stay

Reviews.Title: “Attention to Detail & Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ajcharleston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Britt Scripps in the Library Room, and had a wonderful time in San Diego. The hotel is only a few minutes from Balboa Park, and the Airport. The house is gorgeous--restored to the very last detail. Our room had a large claw foot tub, a feather top queen bed and 1000 thread count sheets. The breakfast selections are wonderful--home made pancakes, omlets, muffins and coffee. The staff was kind enough to even print up tickets for our visit to the zoo so we didn't have to stand in line. Overall the inn provided an inviting and relaxing stay. I would highly recommend this to anyone visiting San Diego.

HotelInfo.Name: Britt Scripps Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 406 Maple Street, San Diego, CA 92103
